revised_title: The Origin and Production of Tripoli: A Study of Petrified Wood
tldr: The author, Martin Hubner, explores the origin and production of Tripoli, a type of natural stone, by studying a mountain in Upper Brittany. He hypothesizes that Tripoli is formed from petrified wood that has been calcined by subterranean fire. Hubner also discusses the possibility of a deluge contributing to the accumulation of wood in the mountain. This research provides insight into the geological processes behind the formation of Tripoli and the role of volcanoes in its production.
